isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Service (1995 through 1999) - SECTION: INTRODUCTION - FUEL INJECTOR COMPONENTS - INTENSIFIER PISTON AND PLUNGER

svcproc.title: INTENSIFIER PISTON AND PLUNGER
svcproc.para:
When the poppet valve opens the inlet port, high pressure oil enters the injector and acts on the top of the intensifier piston. Pressure builds on the intensifier, pushing it and the plunger down. The intensifier is seven (7) times larger on the DT 466E, and six (6) times larger on the International® 530E, in surface area than the plunger; providing an equal multiplication of force. The downward movement of the plunger pressurizes the fuel in the plunger cavity, causing the nozzle to open ( Figure i.20
).
